data.enText: the feeling of having lost all hope
She uttered a cry of despair.

data.chText: 深深的绝望使他痛苦不堪。
data.enText: A deep sense of despair overwhelmed him.
He gave up the struggle in despair .

data.chText: 一句严厉的话就会使她陷入极度的绝望之中。
data.enText: One harsh word would send her into the depths of despair .

data.chText: 他被逼得走投无路，最后卧轨自杀。
data.enText: Eventually, driven to despair , he threw himself under a train.
be the despair of sb
to make sb worried or unhappy, because they cannot help

data.chText: 我的字写得很差，使老师们感到十分失望。
data.enText: My handwriting was the despair of my teachers.
a counsel of despair
advice not to try to do sth because it is too difficult

data.chText: 绝望；失去希望；丧失信心
data.enText: to stop having any hope that a situation will change or improve

data.chText: 别灰心！我们会找到出路的。
data.enText: Don't despair! We'll think of a way out of this.

data.chText: 他们对生孩子几乎不抱任何希望了。
data.enText: They'd almost despaired of ever having children.

data.chText: 我对他都绝望了，他做任何工作都超不过半年。
data.enText: I despair of him; he can't keep a job for more than six months.

simple_means.memory_skill: de 否定 + spair〔=sper〕希望 → 不抱希望 → 绝望

ex.chText: 不幸的是，她在绝望中自杀了。
ex.enText: Tragically, she took her own life in despair.

ex.chText: 让经理绝望的是，会计携款潜逃了。
ex.enText: To the despair of the manager, the accountant absconded with the money.

synonyms.bx: 指完全失去希望和信心的感觉。

ex.chText: 贝丝因错过了这场比赛而垂头丧气。
ex.enText: Beth showed her dejection at missing the game.

synonyms.bx: 指灰心失望、沮丧气馁的心理状态。

ex.chText: 绝望之际，他们放弃抵抗投降了。
ex.enText: In desperation, they gave up resistance and surrendered.

ex.chText: 巨额债务逼得他铤而走险。
ex.enText: The huge debt drove him to desperation.

synonyms.bx: 指丧失一切希望、走投无路的状态。

data.enText: be the despair of sb
to make sb worried or unhappy, because they cannot help

data.chText: 我的字写得很差，使老师们感到十分失望。
data.enText: My handwriting was the despair of my teachers.
a counsel of despair
advice not to try to do sth because it is too difficult

tr: the feeling that everything is wrong and nothing will turn out well
example: they moaned in despair and dismay
one harsh word would send her into the depths of despair

tr: a state in which all hope is lost or absent
example: they were rescued from despair at the last minute
Don't despair--help is on the way!

value.def: Despair is the feeling that everything is wrong and that nothing will improve.

example.ex: I looked at my wife in despair...

value.def: If you despair, you feel that everything is wrong and that nothing will improve.

example.ex: 'Oh, I despair sometimes,' he says in mock sorrow...
example.tran: “啊，我有时会感到绝望，”他假装悲伤地说。

example.ex: He does despair at much of the press criticism.
example.tran: 面对媒体的诸多批评他的确感到绝望。

value.def: If you despair of something, you feel that there is no hope that it will happen or improve. If you despair of someone, you feel that there is no hope that they will improve.

example.ex: He wished to earn a living through writing but despaired of doing so.
example.tran: 他想通过写作来谋生，不过他对此不抱希望。

example.ex: ...efforts to find homes for people despairing of ever having a roof over their heads...
example.tran: 为那些对有瓦遮头不再抱有任何希望的人们找到住处的努力

example.ex: There are signs that many voters have already despaired of politicians.
example.tran: 有迹象表明许多选民对政客已经不抱希望。

value.tran: 对…感到绝望;对…不抱希望

trans: 绝望；失望；失望地；短语结构；绝望地
对…绝望，不抱希望；对（某人，尤其对其行为）感到十分焦急，担心

partsOfSpeech.dec: de 否定 + spair〔=sper〕希望 → 不抱希望 → 绝望
de 否定 + sper 希望 + ado → 没有希望无所顾忌 → 亡命徒
de 否定 + sper 希望 + ate 具有…的 → 没有希望 → 绝望的
de 否定 + sper 希望 + ation，desperate 的名词 → 绝望
pro 在前 + sper 希望 → 希望在前 → 繁荣
pro 在前 + sper 希望 + ity，prosper 的名词 → 繁荣昌盛
pro 在前 + sper 希望 + ous …的，prosper的形容词 → 繁荣的
